docs.lead_paragraph: The discussion on Motherlode yesterday about the ever expanding number of ways to have a baby brought comments from many of you who were perplexed by the willingness to try anything and many who tried to explain that "anything" is a place you never thought you'd reach when you began, a place you got to one intervention at a time.
docs.abstract: Guest blogger Kelcey Kintner, a mother of two who longs for a third, wonders why she can't simply be satisfied with what she already has.
docs.snippet: Guest blogger Kelcey Kintner, a mother of two who longs for a third, wonders why she can't simply be satisfied with what she already has.

docs.lead_paragraph: A TV viewer who recently watched an episode of the NBC series "Kings" was surprised to see a commercial for Trojan condoms during the show. And a second spot. And a third. And two more.

headline.main: Policies on Condom Ads Can Take a Different Direction Online

docs.abstract: it turns out that Hulu, a joint venture of NBC Universal and News Corporation, accepts condom advertising without the restrictions imposed upon such spots by NBC or Fox.
docs.snippet: it turns out that Hulu, a joint venture of NBC Universal and News Corporation, accepts condom advertising without the restrictions imposed upon such spots by NBC or Fox.

docs.lead_paragraph: “They came to learn his secrets. Well before the appointed hour of two o’clock in the afternoon on November 12, 1877, hundreds of spectators pushed into a courtroom in lower Manhattan.”

headline.seo: ‘The First Tycoon,’ by T. J. Stiles

docs.snippet: “They came to learn his secrets. Well before the appointed hour of two o’clock in the afternoon on November 12, 1877, hundreds of spectators pushed into a courtroom in lower Manhattan.”
